With the Crusaders and Mongols at the door...

text: …devletini seven hiç kimse buna razı gelemez
english: ...no one who loves his government can consent to this.

text: Beyim... Süleyman Şah, Ebu Hişam’ı arıyor!
english: My lord, Süleyman Shah is looking for Abu Hisham.
You go out, Alpargu.
Do you think your old man understands?
He's the most dangerous man you'll ever meet.
What are we gonna do?
If you run away, he'll find you.

text: 100 Alpin elinde esameniz okunmaz Derinizi yüzer
english: 100 Alpins, you can't read. He'll skin you.
Wait.
You were helping put out the fire...
So I came and picked you up.

text: Kurdoğlu, eniği olacak o it ölmediyse…
english: Kurdoglu, if that son of a bitch isn't dead...
...we're all in trouble.
If the boy talks, it's a disaster.
Let's go.
I heard you were looking for me, sir.

text: Yanan samanlık adamlarınızın kaldığı yerin yakınında Ebu Hişam
english: Near where your burning haystack men are staying, Abu Hasham
Yes, sir.

text: Yangını fark ettiğimizde iş işten geçmişti
english: When we discovered the fire, it was too late.

text: Sabah erken yola çıkacağımız için erken yatmışlardı
english: They went to bed early because we were leaving early in the morning.
When they woke up from the noise, they intervened in the fire.
So I did my best.

text: Peki, şüpheli bir şey gördün mü?
english: Well, did you see anything suspicious?
No, sir.

text: Beyim, Ebu Hişam yangını söndürmeye çalışırken omzuna kalas düşmüş
english: Sir, Abu Hisham fell on his shoulder trying to put out the fire.

text: Müsaaden olursa ben onu Akçakoca’ya götüreyim
english: If you don't mind, I'll take him to the Akça husband.
The Akça husband is inside, Kurdoğlu
What's the matter, sir?
Someone tried to kill Dündar
Sir, what do you think?

text: Samanlığı yakan da Dündar’dı Obayı büyük bir felaketten kurtardı
english: The man who burned the haystack had saved Obaya from a great disaster

text: Allah acil şifalar versin Büyük geçmiş olsun
english: May God give you a speedy recovery and good health to you.
Is there anything we can do?

text: Kusura kalmayın tedbirli davranıp eşyalarınızı arattım
english: I'm sorry. I've been cautious and had your things searched.
It is God's will, my lord, to be wary of Him.

text: Ne demek, olur mu öyle şey?
english: What do you mean, no way?

text: Gönlünüzü rahat tutun siz yapılması gerekeni yaptınız
english: Keep your heart at ease. You did what had to be done.
Get your men out of the room right now.
We expect an attack.

text: Sizin emniyetinizi temin edemezsem içim rahat etmez
english: If I can't guarantee your safety, I won't feel comfortable.

text: Bizleri düşündüğünüz için Allah sizden razı olsun
english: God bless you for thinking of us.
Whatever you think is appropriate.
Kurdoğlu Yes, sir.
Release the men behind them.
Let them watch every step of the way
Don't let them get too close.
Yes, sir.
Gökçe
Thank you, Mother Hayme.
I know you want to know what I have to say
Dündar our son is young, strong
She's exactly the age of the Alps.

text: Hani taşı sıksa suyunu çıkartır maşallah
english: If he squeezes the stone, he'll turn it into water.

text: Canı gönülden Allah-ü Teâlâ’nın şifa vereceğine inanır, onun için dua ederiz
english: We truly believe that God will heal him, and we pray for him.

text: Aldığı kılıç darbesi belki de onu bizden alacak kadar cüretkâr değildir
english: Maybe the sword blow he took wasn't bold enough to take him away from us.

text: Lakin beni endişelendiren başka bir mesele vardır
english: But there's something else that concerns me.
The beating on his head as he fell

text: İşte beni asıl bu endişelendirir beyim
english: That's what worries me, sir.
What do you mean, white husband?
Ahh.
So...
...the body can withstand this sword blow.
But...
But his brain...
...brain...
White husband, spit it out.
Tell us so we know.
The blow to the head...
...probably caused some kind of damage to their minds.

text: Belki de bundan böyle Dündar oğlumuzun…
english: Perhaps, from now on, our son's...

text: …ölüm uykusunda uzun ve sancılı bir hayatı olabilir, Hayme Ana
english: ...a long and painful life in the sleep of death, Mother Hayme.

text: Halebi Hazretleri de Şam’a gitti Dergâh hepten başsız kaldı
english: His Highness has gone to Damascus. The camp is completely headless.

text: Bu işi bugün ne olursa olsun halletmemiz lazım
english: We need to get this done no matter what happens today.

text: Bizden sebep dergâhtaki dervişlerin de canı tehlikede
english: We're the reason the dervishes are in danger.

text: Bizim yüzümüzden dervişlerin başına bir hâl gelse hâlimiz nice olur?
english: What would happen if something happened to the dervishes because of us?
What do we say to Ibn Al-Arabi?
I don't want to...
Ertugrul?
We have to go now, brother!
You're not coming.
Brother, don't!
Ertugrul, they won't let you in that palace.
And if they do, they won't let them out, you know.

text: Elçi olarak benim gitmemde fayda var
english: As ambassador, I'd better go.
What happened at the palace?

text: Şu Dündar veledi her şeyi berbat etti
english: That Dündar kid ruined everything.
He set fire to the haystack and put the oba on alert.
It's just like Ertugrul's childhood.
I'll come again Kurdoğlu
And when I do, I'm gonna finish it.
Dündar must die.
If he talks...
It's up to you to kill Solomon Shah.

text: Gördüğüm kadarıyla da buna gücün yetmez
english: And from what I can see, you can't afford it.
What about El Aziz?
His army is about to leave.
I did my best.

text: Ne yapıp edip El Aziz’in ordusunu engellemelisin
english: Whatever you do, you must stop the army of El Aziz.

text: Umarım beyin teslim olmayı kabul eder
english: I hope the brain agrees to surrender.
Have a nice day, brother Kurdoglu.
Godspeed, Abu Hasham.

text: Benim aydan güzel, benden deli kızım
english: My beautiful moon, my crazy daughter
He's the one who's going after his nephew...
...the nightmare of the Namerdin, my good girl.
Welcome back. Welcome back.

text: Baba, Turgut’un esir tutulduğu kalenin yerini öğrendim
english: Father, I've learned the location of the castle where the Turtle is being held prisoner.
You been there, girl?
I'm gone, Dad.
All right, girl.

text: Şimdi beyimizin yanına gidelim olup biteni anlat, ha?
english: Now let's go to our gentleman and tell him what's going on, huh?
Desturation
I've been waiting for you to come, Kurdoglu.

text: Gelip de olanları anlatayım diye çadırın önünde nasıl eşelendiğini gördüm
english: I saw how you dug in front of the tent so I could come and tell you what happened.

text: Küçük bir çocuğu bile öldürmekten aciz adamlarla iş koşarsan böyle olur
english: That's what happens when you run into men who can't even kill a little boy.

text: Ayağımız çamura girmeden hasadı toplamaya kalkıyoruz, Selcan Hatun
english: We try to harvest before our feet get in the mud, Selcan Hatun.
Put your foot in the mud.
In fact, get down to your throat in the mud.

text: Anca o zaman beni ardında bulursun
english: Only then will you find me behind you
So you trust me that much?

text: Biz seninle artık kaderi üleşir dururuz Kurdoğlu
english: We'll meet our destiny now, Kurdoglu.
Either we get what we want...
Or feed our bodies to the vultures.
Abu Hasham will come again.
What's in it for him?
We'll be in the same sights.
Watch out Kurdoglu

text: Attığınız ok, dönüp sizi kaba etinizden vurmasın
english: Don't let that arrow of yours turn and shoot you in the rough meat.

text: Sana gitme vaktidir Aykız geldi, gidip bakayım neler anlatır
english: It's time for you to go. The moon girl is here. I'll go see what she has to say.
Here you go, sir.

text: Sen de iki adamını al, peşinden git Fazla yaklaşmayın
english: You take two of your men, go after him, don't get too close.

text: Ebu Hişam senin iki Alple peşinden gideceğini biliyor
english: Abu Hisham knows you're going after two Alples.
Go back to the office before you start asking about the Alps next to you.
Solomon will question them, too.
If he finds out we're playing games...
He once suspected Abu Hisham.

text: Uğursuz, kafasında bu işi çözene kadar bitirmeyecektir
english: The jinx won't finish until he figures it out in his head.
Let's go.

text: Gördüm ki Tapınakçıların kalesine koca bir orduyla bile girilemez beyim
english: I've seen that the Templar's castle can't be broken into even by a large army, sir.

text: Alamut’ta gördüğümüz Haşhaşilerin kalesi gibi mi?
english: Like the castle of the Hashishis we saw in Alamut?
Yes, sir.
He's the head of the pot, Mr. Alamut.
A demon called Hasan Sabbah
And Sultan Alparslan.

text: …oğlu Melikşah’ı da o iblisin adamları öldürdüler
english: His son, Melikşah, was killed by that demon's men.

text: Bu Tapınakçılar da ne biliyorlarsa onlardan öğrendiler
english: These Templars learned from what they knew.

text: Birisi Allah’ın kitabına şirk sokup Müslümanları…
english: Someone puts partners in the Book of Allah and makes Muslims...
...others poison Christians with what they learn from them.
So take one, shoot the other
The only way to get into that castle is through deception.

text: O hileyi bulup o kaleye bir an önce girmeliyiz beyim
english: We need to find that trick and get into that castle, sir.

text: Turgut hâlâ o kaledeyse, onu oradan çekip almak boynumuzun borcudur
english: If Turgut's still in that castle, we owe it to ourselves to pull him out of there.
A will of steel

text: Senin gibi on tane şövalyem olsa…
english: If I had ten knights like you...
Jerusalem would be ours by now.
From now on I'll call you Judas
Your name among us will be Judas
Judas

text: İsa’ya ihanet eden havarinin adını veriyorum sana
english: I give you the name of the apostle who betrayed Jesus.
Never forget who you are
Judas
Get him ready!
I'll show the castle to our new knight
I hope you break your hands!
What did you want with the little boy?
What did the white husband say, Hayme Ma?
He said his wounds would heal slowly.
He said young, strong
Oh...
Hayme Ana?
But...
But...
...to the end of your life...

text: Senden bir isteğim var Hafize Ana
english: I have a favor to ask you, Mother Hafize.
I'm listening, Mr. Ertugrul.

text: Sarayın dadısı Ümmül Hayr eşin Halebi’nin kardeşidir
english: The court's nanny, Ommül Hayr, is the brother of your wife Halebi.
In and out of the palace.

text: Halime Sultan’a, onunla konuşmak istediğimi söyleyip…
english: Halima told Sultan I wanted to talk to him...
Can you bring it to the gift shop?
It's too dangerous, Mr. Ertugrul.

text: Hem senin için, hem o kızcağız için
english: For you, and for that girl.
I know.
But...
...if I can't talk to him...
...it would be a disaster for all of us.
I'll go to the palace for you.
But if she doesn't want to come...
I can't afford it.

text: Allah senden razı olsun Hafize Ana
english: God bless you, Mother Hafize.
I'll take my leave of absence.
Why did you do that, sister?

text: O senin için, bizim için ne zorluklar çekti biliyor musun?
english: Do you know what she's been through for you, for us?

text: Turgut abi bizi kurtarmak için zindanda ne eziyetler görüyor, farkında mısın?
english: Do you have any idea how much pain he's going through in the dungeon to save us?
How could you do this, sister?
I had to, hero.
For you, for my father

text: Keşke bıraksaydın da Turgut abimle beraber beni de öldürselerdi
english: I wish you'd let them kill me with my brother, Turgut.
I beg you not to speak like that, my hero.

text: Sen ne yaptığını biliyor musun abla?
english: Do you know what you're doing, sister?
Ertugrul, you killed my brother.

text: İster inan, ister inanma Halime Sultan…
english: Believe it or not, Halima Sultan...
...that's what destiny is all about.

text: Ne işin var senin burada Kara Toygar?
english: What are you doing here, Black Toygar?

text: Seni El Aziz budalasının yatağından kurtarmaya geldim
english: I've come to rescue you from the bed of El Aziz's fool.

text: Bu saraydaki tek dostum benim, Halime
english: I'm the only friend in this palace, Halima

text: Sen eli kanlı, adi bir canisin Kara Toygar
english: You're a bloody, vile villain, Black Toygar.
Welcome home, Titus.

text: Olanları öğrendim efendim Hemen Halep’e gitmeliyim
english: I've learned what happened, sir. I must go to Aleppo immediately.

text: Eftelya’nın yaşaması hepimiz için bir tehdit
english: The life of Efteliah is a threat to all of us.
If his cover gets blown, we'll lose Aleppo.

text: Seninle her zaman gurur duydum Titus
english: I've always been proud of you, Titus.

text: Kayıların arasına sızman da çok iyi oldu
english: It's good of you to infiltrate the apricots.

text: Kardinal, Papa ve İmparator Friedrich için hazırladığı raporu bitirdi mi efendim?
english: Did the Cardinal finish his report for the Pope and Emperor Friedrich, sir?
No.
Or he's lying to me.

text: Bu iş sandığımdan daha zor olacak Titus
english: This is gonna be harder than I thought, Titus.
The Cardinal, if necessary.

text: …kardeşim Giovanni gibi bir Müslüman'ın kılıcıyla ölmek durumunda kalabilir
english: ...my brother may have to die with the sword of a Muslim like Giovanni.
Do you understand me?

text: Titus, giderken El Aziz için hazırlattığım hediyeyi de götür
english: Titus, take the gift I had prepared for El Aziz.
It's gonna be the bloodiest wedding in history.

text: Keşke davetliler arasında ben de olabilseydim
english: I wish I could be one of the guests.

text: Sizi en iyi şekilde temsil ederim efendim
english: I'll represent you as best I can, sir.
I don't doubt it, Titus.
Not at all.

text: Burada ne işi var Kara Toygar’ın?
english: What's Black Toygar doing here?

text: Şehzade kızıyla evleneceğinizi öğrenmiş olmalı Sultan Alaeddin
english: The prince must have found out you were marrying his daughter, Sultan Alaeddin.
And to prevent that...
He sent you his one-eyed monster, sir.
Sir, prepare for threats
Do not surrender
So, what should we do, Nasser?

text: Onu derhal huzurunuzdan gönderin gitsin efendim
english: Send him away immediately, sir.
And without waiting for the wedding preparations...
...Take Halime Sultan to your wedding.
You can do the wedding at the same time.

text: Olur mu o şekilde, düğünsüz paldır küldür?
english: How's that for a wedding without a wedding?

text: Benim gibi bir melikle Halime gibi bir şehzade kızına yakışır mı?
english: Would a lion like me fit in with a prince's daughter like Halima?

text: Efendim, söz konusu devletimizin güvenliğiyse yakışır
english: Sir, if it's the safety of our state, it'll suit you.
I'm glad you're here, Nasser.
May God keep you on my side.
The recordings have sent a messenger, sir.
We're holding him at the palace gate.
Baksi Beyrek, that's enough!
Sit down, I'm dizzy!

text: Bu avrat kısmı var ya, hepsi böyle!
english: That's all that's going on here.

text: Hayda! Ulan seni de bir ana doğurmadı mı?
english: Didn't a mother give birth to you?
Don't mess with my mother!
I'm talking about Halima sister.

text: Otağa girdi bir öyle şimdi saraya girdi, böyle
english: He's in the tent, and now he's in the palace, like this.
He sold my Master Ertugrul, he sold it!
Shut up, my master will hear you.
For God's sake!
I won't forgive him till he's dead.
Oh, shit!
This is my sister's game.
It's a shame...
There was no trouble you didn't have to go to.
You've got yourself, your Alps...
You put the club in danger for him.
You even put us in front of you.
Who are you talking about?
From that prince's daughter
I'm talking about Halima Sultan.
A prince's daughter

text: senin gibi keçi kokan bir çobana gönül vereceğini mi sandın?
english: Did you think he'd go for a goat-smelling shepherd like you?
He used you, Ertugrul.
He brought it all the way here.

text: Kendi gibi asil bir emir bulunca da…
english: And when he finds a noble order like himself...
...just walked right into his corner.
You're mad at me, but...
...when you brought him to the palace with your own hands.
I knew this would happen, Ertugrul.
You know...
I was the woman that El Aziz loved. I was the favorite.
I know his tastes very well.
Halima is exactly what she wants.
Aww...
He used to write poems for me.

text: İsa aşkına, her gün o berbat şiirlere katlanmak zorunda kaldım
english: Jesus Christ, I had to put up with those awful poems every day.
From now on, Sultan Halima will take my place.
On the long Aleppo nights...
...he will find comfort in Halime's young body.

text: Ömrümde hiçbir kadına elimi kaldırmadım Allah bana o utancı da yaşatmasın
english: I've never laid a hand on a woman in my life, and I don't want God to put me through that shame.

text: Şerefli bir adam da bunu asla yapmaz
english: An honorable man would never do that.
But...
Just so you know...

text: …aklıma her geldiğinde cehennemde yanman için dua edeceğim
english: Every time you come to my mind, I'll pray that you'll burn in hell.
Not just for the lives you take.
...the lies, the slanders...

text: …ağzından ateş olup kusman için dua edeceğim
english: I'm gonna pray that you get a fever out of your mouth and throw up.
Suleyman Shah's son Gündoğdu Bey
I told you I wanted to see you alone.

text: Nasır, bu şehirde benden sonra en yetkili kişidir
english: Nasser is the man in charge of this city after me.

text: Ona sadece hayatımı haremimi, namusumu değil…
english: I don't just want to give him my life, my harem, my honor...
I've entrusted my city as well.

text: Sen kimsin ki onun burada olmasından rahatsızlık duyuyorsun ha?
english: Who are you to bother with her being here, huh?

text: Zaten obanızı topraklarıma aldığımdan beri başım beladan kurtulmuyor
english: I haven't been able to get out of trouble since I've already got your obana on my land.

text: Bir de utanmadan karşıma geçmiş bana ne yapacağımı söylüyorsun
english: And you show up in front of me shamelessly telling me what to do?
It's a shame.

text: O hâlde ihanetlerin en büyüğünü yaşamaya müstahaksınız Emir Hazretleri
english: Then you deserve to experience the greatest betrayal, Your Highness.

text: Dedeniz Selahattin Eyyubi’nin kurduğu devletin bu güzeller güzeli şehrini…
english: This beautiful city of the state founded by your grandfather, Selahattin Ayyubi.
...you've already sold blasphemy.

text: Sen ne hakla bana… Emir Hazretleri…
english: How dare you... your highness...
...let him speak, Your Highness.
You said...

text: …Müslüman kanı dökmeden bu tatsız meseleyi halletmek…
english: ...to settle this unpleasant matter without spilling Muslim blood...
It's either your religion or your conscience.
Nice.

text: bu etrak-ı bi idrak taifesinin imanından şüphe etsem de…
english: As much as I doubt the faith of this field of understanding...
Nasser...

text: …bir zamanlar devletine ihanet eden bir Selçuklu komutanı vardı
english: Once upon a time, there was a Seljukian commander who betrayed his government.

text: Onu en son gördüğümde obamızın meydanında köpekler gibi havlıyordu
english: The last time I saw him, he was barking like a dog in our obama square.

text: Yazık, senin öyle bir zamanın olmayacak
english: Too bad you won't have that kind of time.
I don't know what you're...
...how he infiltrated the palace...

text: …Tapınakçılardan nasıl emir aldığını çok yakında Emir Hazretleri öğrenecek
english: ...how you received orders from the temples will soon be informed by His Majesty.
Enough!
If you're an ambassador, know your embassy.
Or I don't care about the rules...
I'll take that head of yours, Turkmen.
Sir, you talk to him.
I'll wait for you outside.
It's a lie.
You won't fool me with these slanders.
If you've got any guts...

text: …kendine Esma diyen Eftelya adındaki kadınla ilgili…
english: ...about a woman named Eftelya who calls herself Esma...
...you'll learn the truth, Your Highness.
All I ask of you is...

text: …Leyla’nın dadısıyla birlikte onu size getirmeme müsaade etmeniz
english: ...let me bring her to you with the nanny of Leila.
Why are you bringing my nanny into this?

text: Ertuğrul’u ihbar ettirip zindana attıran o
english: He's the one who got Ertugrul to report him and put him in prison.
He loves you as much as his own son.

text: Üstelik Ertuğrul’un ve sizin güvenebileceğiniz tek kişi de o
english: Besides, he's the only one you and Ertugrul can trust.

text: Emir Hazretleri, o size asla ihanet etmez
english: Your Highness, he would never betray you.

text: Sizin ve kız kardeşiniz Leyla’nın iyiliğinden başka bir şey istemez
english: You and your sister want nothing but the kindness of Leyla.

text: Üstelik sarayda Tapınakçı olmadığından emin olduğumuz üç kişiden biri
english: And he's one of the three people in the palace we know for sure he's not a Templar.
Who are the other two?
Your sister Leyla and you
You say you can't get Esma to talk.
What if he doesn't talk again?
How do you prove it?

text: Kafasının arkasında, saçlarının arasında gömülü bir haç var
english: There's a cross buried in the back of his head between his hair.

text: Hatırlayın, Ertuğrul’u öldürmek için saraya gelen Tapınakçıların da öyleydi
english: Remember, so were the Templars who came to the palace to kill Ertugrul.
You'll see for yourself
All right, that's enough, girls.

text: Hadi bakalım, biraz nefes alsın kızcağız
english: Come on, let's give her a break.
Come, Halima.
You look beautiful.

text: El Aziz benim evladımdan ötedir Halime
english: El Aziz is more than my son Halima
Get used to it.
You'll see, you'll love her
His heart is so pure
He's respectful, he's kind
He cares a lot about women.
When I'm with him

text: sevilmenin, şımartılmanın baş tacı edilmenin keyfini yaşayacaksın
english: You're gonna enjoy being loved, pampered, primed.

text: Biraz fırsat ver ona, zaman tanı
english: Give him a chance, give him time
I saw Black Toygar.
Aaah!

text: Sarayda ne işi var dadı, biliyor musunuz?
english: Do you know what she's doing in the palace, Nanny?
Seljuk Sultan Alaeddin Keykubat

text: El Aziz'le görüşmesi için elçi olarak göndermiş onu
english: He sent her as a messenger to meet El Aziz.
What do they have to discuss?
You and El Aziz's marriage.

text: Sultan bu evliliğe mani olmak için onu bizzat göndermiş diyorlar
english: They say the Sultan himself sent him to prevent this marriage.
Mm-hmm.
Got it.
It's too much to say.

text: muteber bir davranış değil Emir Hazretleri
english: It's not admissible, Your Highness.
Let's cut to the chase.
If you marry our prince's daughter
He's got business with our prince.
Türkmen caliph

text: ayaklanmaya teşvik ettiğinizi düşünmek zorunda kalacağız

doesn't threaten.

Isodora!

They're your real brothers.

english: All the Jihan states will come together.

text: Karım ol dediğinde sana hayır dedim
english: When you said be my wife, I said no.

text: Bunun içimdeki acısını sana söyleyemedim Ertuğrul
english: I couldn't tell you the pain in my heart, Ertugrul.

text: Ben babam için, kardeşim için kendimi feda ettim
english: I sacrificed myself for my father, for my brother.

text: Eğer beni El Aziz'in elinden alırsan
english: If you take me away from El Aziz

english: His anger burns all of Kai Obal to ashes, Ertuğrul
I know everything.

text: Ertuğrul, babam beni El Aziz'le evlendirmeye mecbur ediyor
english: Ertugrul, my father compels me to marry El Aziz.

text: Ama her ne pahasına olursa olsun o adamla evlenmeyeceğim!
english: But I will not marry that man at all costs!

text: Sen gelip kurtarana kadar seni bekleyeceğim Ertuğrul
english: I'll wait for you until you come and save me, Ertugrul.
If I can't come
I want you to know

english: With my love for you, I can't reach that man's bed

english: I will not bring you to memory of the state established by my ancestor Selçuk, nor you!
Now go!
Save the Oban from those degenerates.
Don't worry about me.

english: My heart will beat with you till my last breath
Halima!
Not El Aziz.

text: tüm cihan bir araya gelse seni benden alamaz!

I'll come get you.
I promise.
